content:
Key Findings

  • Lancashire County Council spent a total of £3,685.9 million across 753,220 transactions between 2024/25 and 2025/26.
  • The council's spending data showed no significant anomalies or red flags during automated analysis.
  • No specific suppliers were highlighted as unusual or concerning in the spending data.
  • The data covered a comprehensive range of transactions, indicating thorough reporting practices.

Comprehensive Spending Overview

Lancashire County Council's spending data for the financial years 2024/25 to 2025/26 reveals a total expenditure of £3,685.9 million. This substantial figure is spread across 753,220 individual transactions, demonstrating the council's extensive financial activities. The data, published under the Local Government Transparency Code, provides a detailed snapshot of how public funds are allocated and spent.

The sheer volume of transactions—753,220—indicates a high level of financial activity and suggests that the council is actively managing a wide range of services and projects. This level of detail is crucial for ensuring transparency and accountability in public spending.

Automated Analysis and Findings

Automated analysis of Lancashire County Council's spending data flagged no significant issues. This includes checks for duplicates, split payments, round-number anomalies, and adherence to Benford's Law. The absence of red flags suggests that the council's financial processes are robust and that the data is reliable.

The analysis did not highlight any specific suppliers as unusual or concerning. This is a positive indicator, as it suggests that the council's procurement processes are functioning effectively and that suppliers are being managed appropriately. The data does not provide information on unique suppliers, but the overall spending patterns appear to be consistent and well-documented.

What You Can Do

  • Submit a Freedom of Information request to Lancashire County Council about specific spending patterns or procurement processes.
  • Attend council committee meetings, which are open to the public, to gain insights into financial decision-making.
  • Check the council's published contracts register to review details of major contracts and suppliers.
  • Write to your local councillor about any concerns or questions regarding the council's spending and financial management.
  • Visit aidoge.co.uk to explore the full spending data and conduct your own analysis.
This article is based on Lancashire County Council's published spending data covering 2024/25 to 2025/26. All figures are drawn directly from transactions published under the Local Government Transparency Code. Analysis by AI DOGE.
